oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of three detection strategies on the odds of lameness cure in dairy cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wynands, Erin
Moe, David
Cramer, Gerard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lameness
dairy cattle
animal welfare
economic
detection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The high prevalence of lameness in US freestall dairy herds is both an animal welfare and an economic concern. To achieve a low prevalence of lameness, strategies to lower incidence need to be combined with methods to decrease duration. This requires rapid and effective methods to detect and treat lameness. The objective of this study was to evaluate the impact of 3 lameness detection strategies on the odds of cure of lameness.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2016; 158
